lines: Hey there! I'm Luca. Nice party, right?
I only met Valentin recently through mutual friends.
But man, everyone talks about his erdbeerstrudel! Can't wait to try it.
introduction.notebookNote: Luca is relatively new to the group. Excited about trying the famous strudel.

lines: Whoa, this is intense! Someone actually ate it?
I barely know anyone here, so it definitely wasn't me.
I was checking out the books on the far wall. Didn't see anything.
followUpLines: This is wild. My first party here and this happens?
I hope you find who did it. I don't want to be suspected!
Being the new person makes me look suspicious, doesn't it?

lines: You found a clue? That's something at least.
Look, I know I'm the new guy, but I swear I didn't do it.
Although... I did notice something odd behind the bookshelf earlier. Might be worth checking out?
followUpLines: Did you check behind the bookshelf?
I'm just trying to be helpful here!
Please believe me, I'm not the culprit.
postIncident.notebookNote: Luca is defensive about being new. Mentioned something behind the bookshelf.

lines: Wow, you're really solving this mystery!
Okay, I'll be completely honest now.
I saw Marianne near the dessert table right before Valentin left. She was acting kind of nervous.
followUpLines: I probably should have mentioned that earlier...
But I didn't want to throw anyone under the bus without proof.
Go ahead and check behind that bookshelf like I mentioned.
postIncident.notebookNote: Luca saw Marianne near the dessert table looking nervous. Why wait to mention this?

lines: Alright, you got me. I'll come clean.
I did eat a little bit of the strudel. Just a taste!
But when I came back later, the whole thing was gone. Someone else finished it after me!
followUpLines: I know I shouldn't have taken that first bite...
But I was curious! Everyone hyped it up so much!
I'm sorry, okay? But I'm not the only guilty one here.
postIncident.notebookNote: Luca admits to taking 'just a taste' but claims someone else finished it. Believable?
